alert.note: Alert for Grant; Sierra (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 10:06PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest New Mexico, including the following counties, in south central New Mexico, Sierra. In southwest New Mexico, Grant. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sapillo Creek, Holden Prong, West Fork Mimbres River, Sheep Creek, Las Animas Creek, South Fork Mimbres River, South Diamond Creek, East Fork Mimbres River, Apache Creek, Seco Creek, South Fork Palomas Creek, Circle Seven Creek, Morgan Creek, Mimbres River, South Fork North Seco Creek, Mineral Creek, Black Canyon, North Percha Creek, Cave Creek, Salado Creek and Cherry Creek. Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hermosa and Cooney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
